name: vscode-colormate
description: ColorMate colors all similarly named variables the same, so you can quickly and easily skim your code by reading colors instead of text. The hashing algorithm is modeled after the same amazing CRC8 hasher used by Colorcoder for Sublime Text.
author: Kevin Ghadyani

colormate.darkTheme.lighting.markdownDescription: This controls the `lighting` in a dark color theme. This is used in an HSL function.

colormate.darkTheme.saturation.markdownDescription: This controls the `saturation` in a dark color theme. This is used in an HSL function.

colormate.highContrastDarkTheme.lighting.markdownDescription: This controls the `lighting` in a high-contrast dark color theme. This is used in an HSL function.

colormate.highContrastDarkTheme.saturati.markdownDescription: This controls the `saturation` in a high-contrast dark color theme. This is used in an HSL function.

colormate.highContrastLightTheme.lightin.markdownDescription: This controls the `lighting` in a high-contrast light color theme. This is used in an HSL function.

colormate.highContrastLightTheme.saturat.markdownDescription: This controls the `saturation` in a high-contrast light color theme. This is used in an HSL function.

colormate.lightTheme.lighting.markdownDescription: This controls the `lighting` in a light color theme. This is used in an HSL function.

colormate.lightTheme.saturation.markdownDescription: This controls the `saturation` in a light color theme. This is used in an HSL function.

colormate.semanticTokenTypes.markdownDescription: The types of language tokens that should have a color applied. In addition to the [list of common types](https://code.visualstudio.com/api/language-extensions/semantic-highlight-guide#standard-token-types-and-modifiers), language authors may define their own.

colormate.textMateTokenScopes.markdownDescription:
The types of TextMate language tokens will be semantically highlighted.

TextMate scopes are hierarchical; therefore, `source.tsx` will enable semantic coloring for all idnetifers whereas `support.class.component.tsx` is much more specific.

You can also optionally leave out the language scope (`.tsx`). This allows it to work on all languages, but be careful when doing this! You can never be sure what side-effects will occur when being too generic.

colormate.excludedTextMateTokenScopes.markdownDescription:
Sometimes, TextMate tokens are too generic. To avoid having your own file semantically colored, you can instead use generic tokens (like `source.elixir` then exclude specific scopes with this setting.

These scopes are also hierarchical. So long as they're greater than or equal to the scope of the included scope, they will be excluded.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
